page.title: 02Chesterfield Canal:Gringley
page.content: The Chesterfield Canal near Gringley was first planned in 1769.The Act of Parliament was passed in 1771 and the first part was opened in 1774,and the rest in 1777.It was a convenient way of transporting goods from areas around Chesterfield.Today it is used for leisure eg.swimming (at Middle Bridge) & fishing;canoeing lessons near Smith's Bridge (Grid ref.754 929) and by the derelict Brick works(Grid ref.754 928).The only working barges are those owned by Anglia Water Authority which keep the canal or "cruiser way" clear for those barges giving pleasure-rides.No commercial cargoes are carried by narrow boats nowadays.
